title: Font similar to Bauhaus (but not quite) in logo
content:
Hi all

Need to use this company's logo on some advertising products, can anybody ID it please?

TIA

Helen

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110205041141im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image005-2_5413.jpg)
author: Helenofdestroy

comments.content: It looks like the type was modified for the logo.

Yeah, I know, just can't believe that the person who originally designed it did that much work to it - easy to extend the 'd' and 'c' but not to modify the 'a' or 'd', also the top of the 'c' slightly curves which I can't find anywhere.

Thanks anyway!

H

_...easy to extend the ’d’ and ’c’ but not to modify the ’a’ or ’d’, also the top of the ’c’ slightly curves which I can’t find anywhere._

Oh, I see what you mean... Well, I just searched for faces similar to [ITC Bauhaus on MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20110205041141/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-bauhaus/) and found [Bayer Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20110205041141/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/victory/bayer-sans/) -- it's a lot closer to the face used for the logo!

Yeah, seen that already but the 'c' put me off!

Thanks for your help!
